title: Why China and the U.S. Face Similar Pressures to Resolve Trade Tensions
text: If you want to know the many ways in which China and the U.S. are actually quite similar, and why the years 2020 and 2021 are important, you can ask Sean Darby, the Hong Kong–based global head of equity strategy for Jefferies. For decades, the 55-year-old Darby has been a reliable source of insight for global investors, having worked previously as a strategist at Nomura and Dresdner Kleinwort Benson, and before that as an investment manager himself. We checked in with Darby about what life might look like after the European Central Bank’s launch of a major stimulus package and the political protests in Hong Kong. To learn...
description: China needs to shore up its economy and stabilize its markets ahead of a series of important anniversaries. What that means for investors—and for the Hong Kong protests.
